DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sub-division of the CMCAT values based on sponsor defined characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Concomitant Medication Subcategory
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._A subdivision of concomitant medication data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Subcategory Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of concomitant medication data._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

PermissibleValues.value: FOR DISSEMINATED INTRAVASCULAR COAGULATION DURING HOSPITALIZATION
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: For Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation During Hospitalization

ValueMeaning.preferredName: For Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation During Hospitalization
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The reason of something.: A pathological process where the blood starts to coagulate throughout the whole body. This depletes the body of its platelets and coagulation factors, and there is an increased risk of hemorrhage.: At some point in a given period of time.: The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

Concepts.definition: The reason of something.
A pathological process where the blood starts to coagulate throughout the whole body. This depletes the body of its platelets and coagulation factors, and there is an increased risk of hemorrhage.
At some point in a given period of time.
The condition of being treated as a patient in a hospital.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to or involved in therapy.: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.: The reason of something.: A disorder characterized by occlusion of an arterial vessel by a blood clot that develops in an artery.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or involved in therapy.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
The reason of something.
A disorder characterized by occlusion of an arterial vessel by a blood clot that develops in an artery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to or involved in therapy.: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.: The reason of something.: Occlusion of the lumen of a vein by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or involved in therapy.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
The reason of something.
Occlusion of the lumen of a vein by a thrombus that has migrated from a distal site via the blood stream.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, something that prevents or protects.

Concepts.definition: Any intervention to prevent disease or infection.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Subcategory Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of concomitant medication data.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A subdivision of concomitant medication data.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Clearly characterized or delimited.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
